In 1976, Viking I photographed a mesa on Mars that had the appearance of a human face. Many individuals and organizations interested in extraterrestrial life argued that intelligent beings created the "Face." Though the Mars Global Surveyor (1997-2006) revealed that the "Face" was likely an optical illusion, believers in the "Face" charged NASA with stripping data from the new image before it was released to the public

The Great Red Spot is the most noticeable feature on Jupiter\'s surface - a storm about 12,400 miles long and 7,500 miles wide, about two to three times larger than Earth. Winds at its oval edges can reach up to 425 mph (680 km/h). This giant storm was first recorded in 1831 but may have first been discovered in 1665.

It is made mostly of hydrogen and has a density which is less than water - which technically means that Saturn would float. The layers of hydrogen get denser further into the planet, eventually becoming metallic and leading to a hot interior core.

Alpha Centauri is a special star - not only because it is the closest stellar system to the sun but also because it is one of the relatively few places in the Milky Way Galaxy that may offer terrestrial life conditions. If humanity looks for intelligent life elsewhere, then Alpha Centauri is an excellent candidate.

Most larger galaxies have a supermassive black hole at the center, and the Milky Way is no exception. The center of our galaxy is called Sagittarius A*, a massive source of radio waves that is believed to be a black hole.

For decades, astronomers have been saying that our home galaxy, the Milky Way, is destined someday to collide with the next-nearest spiral galaxy, in the direction of the constellation Andromeda. When they collide, our sun will likely be flung into a new region of galactic space.

The trio of gas columns, located inside the Milky Way\'s Eagle Nebula, are factories for creating stars. The pillars themselves are the product of a massive nearby O-type star that sculpted the gas with its powerful winds. O-stars are the universe\'s largest, hottest stars and live short lives that wreak havoc on their environments.

Quasars are the brightest known objects in visible universe. According to scientists, a quasar is a compact region found at the central part of a massive galaxy and that this central region is actually surrounding supermassive black hole that sits at the very center of the galaxy. A supermassive black hole has mass equivalent to a billion solar masses.

The knowledge that the atoms that comprise life on earth - the atoms that make up the human body, are traceable to the crucibles that cooked light elements into heavy elements in their core under extreme temperatures and pressures. These stars- the high mass ones among them- went unstable in their later years- they collapsed and then exploded- scattering their enriched guts across the galaxy- guts made of all the fundamental ingredients of life itself. These ingredients become part of gas clouds that condense, collapse, form the next generation of solar systems- stars with orbiting planets. And those planets now have the ingredients for life itself. So that when I look up at the night sky, and I know that yes we are part of this universe, we are in this universe, but perhaps more important than both of those facts is that the universe is in us.(c)Neil deGrasse Tyson
